vocabularyItems.english: We must protect the environment for future generations to enjoy.
The forest ecosystem supports thousands of different species of life.
Biodiversity is essential for a healthy planet and ecosystem.
Wildlife conservation efforts have saved many endangered species from extinction.
The preservation of natural habitats is crucial for wildlife.
Sustainability means meeting our needs without harming future generations.
Solar and wind are renewable sources of clean energy.
Fossil fuels like coal and oil pollute the environment.
Carbon emissions from cars contribute to global warming significantly.
Deforestation destroys animal habitats and increases carbon dioxide levels.
Reforestation programs plant millions of trees every year worldwide.
Soil erosion is caused by wind and water over time.
Environmental degradation threatens the planet's future and our survival.
Water contamination from factories affects millions of people's health.
Toxic chemicals in the river killed all the fish.
Hazardous waste must be disposed of properly and safely.
The landfill is full of garbage and non-recyclable waste.
Recycling plastic bottles helps reduce waste in landfills significantly.
Compost turns food waste into nutrient-rich soil naturally.
Organic farming doesn't use chemical pesticides or fertilizers at all.
Pesticides kill insects but can harm beneficial wildlife too.
Chemical fertilizers help plants grow but pollute water sources.
Irrigation systems bring water to dry farmland for crops.
The famine caused widespread hunger and suffering for millions.
The wildfire destroyed thousands of acres of forest land.
Heavy rain triggered a massive landslide on the mountain.
Volcanic eruptions can affect weather patterns globally for years.
Hot lava flowed down the mountain destroying everything nearby.
Magma is molten rock beneath the earth's surface layer.
The volcanic crater is over one kilometer wide today.
Glaciers are melting rapidly due to global warming effects.
The iceberg's tip is only ten percent visible above water.
The Arctic tundra is frozen for most of year.
The African savanna is home to lions and elephants.
The Amazon rainforest produces twenty percent of earth's oxygen.
The dense jungle is difficult to navigate without guide.
The forest canopy blocks sunlight from reaching the ground.
Thick undergrowth makes walking through the forest very difficult.
Lush vegetation covers the hillside in bright green color.
The island's flora includes many rare plant species found.
The fauna of Australia includes unique animals like kangaroos.
This species of bird is found only in region.
The lion is a top predator in the savanna.
Small animals are prey for larger carnivores in wild.
Tigers are carnivores that hunt other animals for food.
Elephants are herbivores that eat only plants and leaves.
Bears are omnivores eating both plants and meat regularly.
Whales are the largest mammals on earth currently living.
Snakes and lizards are cold-blooded reptiles that bask.
Frogs are amphibians that live both on land water.
All vertebrates have a backbone or spinal column structure.
Insects are invertebrates without a backbone at all ever.
Bees are important insects that pollinate flowers and plants.
Pollination by bees is essential for growing many crops.
Bees collect nectar from flowers to make sweet honey.
Pollen from flowers causes allergies in many people seasonally.
Photosynthesis is how plants convert sunlight into energy daily.
Chlorophyll gives plants their characteristic green color always seen.
Germination occurs when seeds begin to sprout and grow.
The tiny seedling will grow into a tree.
We planted young saplings along the roadside last spring.
The bark protects the tree from insects and disease.
Tree roots absorb water and nutrients from the soil.
Small twigs snapped under our feet as we walked.
The leaf changes color in autumn from green yellow.
The autumn foliage is beautiful with red and gold.
Cherry trees blossom with pink flowers in spring season.
The roses bloom beautifully in the warm summer months.
Rose petals are soft and fragrant to the touch.
The flower stem holds the bloom upright and tall.
Be careful of the sharp thorns on rose bushes.
Pull out the weeds from the garden regularly please.
Green moss grows on rocks in damp shady places.
Mushrooms are a type of fungus that grows wild.
Algae grows in ponds and makes water look green.
Coral reefs are home to thousands of fish species.
The Great Barrier Reef is the world's largest structure.
The tide comes in twice a day at beach.
Ocean currents carry warm water around the globe constantly.
Large waves crashed against the rocky shore loudly today.
We walked along the shore collecting beautiful seashells together.
The rugged coastline stretches for hundreds of kilometers far.
A peninsula is land surrounded by water on sides.
The Philippines is an archipelago of over islands total.
The river delta is where it meets the ocean.
An estuary is where fresh river water meets salt.
This tributary flows into the main river downstream eventually.
The watershed provides drinking water for millions of people.
Underground aquifers store vast amounts of fresh water safely.
Recycling plastic bottles helps reduce waste in landfills significantly.
Compost turns food waste into nutrient-rich soil naturally.
Organic farming doesnt use chemical pesticides or fertilizers at all.
Pesticides kill insects but can harm beneficial wildlife too.
Chemical fertilizers help plants grow but pollute water sources.

liarGameData.explanation: A2 learners confuse 'weather' (daily conditions) with 'climate' (long-term patterns). Weather changes daily, climate is average over years.
liarGameData.practice: Weather: 'It's rainy today.' Climate: 'This region has a tropical climate.'
liarGameData.tip: Weather = today's conditions. Climate = typical patterns over many years.
